books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter details some surveillance and intimidation tactics used to pressure journalists and elude consequences by certain wealthy and connected men. Read by the author. 10 hours, 43 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CATCH AND KILL

books.author: Demi Moore
books.description: The Hollywood star chronicles her attempts to balance family and fame. Read by the author. 6 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: INSIDE OUT

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university. Read by Julia Whelan. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Elton John
books.description: The multi-award-winning solo artist's first autobiography. Read by Taron Egerton and the author. 11 hours, 47 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ME

books.author: Edward Snowden
books.description: A memoir by the former National Security Agency contractor who exposed the government’s mass surveillance program. Read by Holter Graham. 11 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.
books.title: PERMANENT RECORD

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Ali Wong
books.description: The comedian dispenses her brand of wisdom through letters to her children. Read by Justin Hakuta and the author. 6 hours, 20 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DEAR GIRLS

books.author: Jonathan Van Ness
books.description: How the hairstylist, comedian and "Queer Eye" star overcame ridicule and trauma. Read by the author. 5 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OVER THE TOP

books.author: Bill Bryson
books.description: An owner’s manual of the human body covering various parts, functions and what happens when things go wrong. Read by the author. 14 hours, 4 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY

books.author: Lori Gottlieb
books.description: A psychotherapist becomes another therapist’s patient. Read by Brittany Pressley. 14 hours, 21 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MAYBE YOU SHOULD TALK TO SOMEONE

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir by the host of “The Daily Show." Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Marc Benioff and Monica Langley
books.contributor: by Marc Benioff and Monica Langley
books.title: TRAILBLAZER

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS

books.author: Shannon Hale
books.contributor: by Shannon Hale. Illustrated by LeUyen Pham
books.description: Shannon struggles to keep up with what is considered cool.
books.title: BEST FRIENDS

books.author: Kohei Horikoshi
books.description: Midoriya has a dream that may reveal secrets while Endeavor fights to reinforce his position as the new No. 1 hero.
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 21

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Callie becomes the stage manager for her middle school’s production of "Moon Over Mississippi."
books.title: DRAMA

books.author: Alan Moore
books.contributor: by Alan Moore. Illustrated by Dave Gibbons
books.description: The 2019 edition of this 1986 title. An unknown assassin goes after a group of disgraced superheroes.
books.title: WATCHMEN

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina experiences braces, boy troubles and other plagues of the sixth grade.
books.title: SMILE

books.author: RJ Palacio
books.description: Julian learns Grandmère's story of being a young Jewish girl who was hidden by a family in Nazi-occupied France during World War II.
books.title: WHITE BIRD

books.author: Bryan Caplan
books.contributor: by Bryan Caplan. Illustrated by Zach Weinersmith
books.description: An economics professor argues that opening all borders could bolster the global economy.
books.title: OPEN BORDERS

books.author: Jennifer L Holm
books.contributor: by Jennifer L. Holm. Illustrated by Matthew Holm
books.description: While others work to stay cool in middle school, Sunny has more fun playing Dungeons & Dragons.
books.title: SUNNY ROLLS THE DICE

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Two sisters discover that their quiet coastal town is haunted.
books.title: GHOSTS

books.author: Robert Kirkman
books.contributor: by Robert Kirkman. Illustrated by Charlie Adlard, Stefano Gaudiano and Cliff Rathburn
books.contributor_note: Illustrated by Charlie Adlard, Stefano Gaudiano and Cliff Rathburn
books.description: In this collected edition of Issues 145-193, Rick Grimes encounters more enemies and allies.
books.title: THE WALKING DEAD: COMPENDIUM, VOL. 4

books.author: Matthew Mercer and Matthew Colville
books.contributor: by Matthew Mercer and Matthew Colville. Illustrated by Olivia Samson
books.description: A group of would-be superheroes come together in this collected edition of Issues 1-6.
books.title: CRITICAL ROLE VOX MACHINA: ORIGINS, VOL. 1

books.author: George Takei, Justin Eisinger and Steven Scott
books.contributor: by George Takei, Justin Eisinger and Steven Scott. Illustrated by Harmony Becker
books.description: A memoir of Takei’s firsthand experiences while imprisoned in a Japanese-American internment camp during World War II.
books.title: THEY CALLED US ENEMY

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.
books.title: NEW KID

books.author: Marjorie Liu
books.contributor: by Marjorie Liu. Illustrated by Sana Takeda
books.description: In this collected edition of Issues 19-24, Maika’s past intersects with a conspiracy that threatens the Known World.
books.title: MONSTRESS, VOL. 4

books.author: John Sandford
books.description: Virgil Flowers investigates shootings in a Minnesota town following an attempt to revive its ailing economy.
books.title: HOLY GHOST

books.author: James Patterson
books.description: Alex Cross returns for the 26th book in the series bearing his name.
books.title: TARGET: ALEX CROSS

books.author: Stephen King
books.description: Now grown up, Dan, the boy with psycho-intuitive powers in “The Shining,” helps another child with a spectacular gift.
books.title: DOCTOR SLEEP

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: Winona Farmington leaves behind the disappointments in her Michigan hometown to visit the English town where her favorite television show is filmed.
books.title: BEAUCHAMP HALL

books.author: Michael Connelly
books.description: Detective Renée Ballard teams up with the retired detective Harry Bosch, who is working on a cold case.
books.title: DARK SACRED NIGHT

books.author: Nora Roberts
books.description: When a pandemic strikes, the world spins into chaos and several travelers head West to find a new life.
books.title: YEAR ONE

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: A decorated World War II veteran shoots and kills a pastor inside a Mississippi church.
books.title: THE RECKONING

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: Two holiday stories: “The Christmas Basket” and “Let It Snow.”
books.title: KISSES IN THE SNOW

books.author: Janet Evanovich
books.description: The 25th book in the Stephanie Plum series. When several managers of a deli in Trenton disappear, a bounty hunter and her detective boyfriend look for clues.
books.title: LOOK ALIVE TWENTY-FIVE

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: A Seattleite cook stuck in remote Ponder, Alaska, grapples with her feelings for the local swordsmith.
books.title: ALASKAN HOLIDAY

books.author: Sandra Brown
books.description: A fallen football star agrees to secretly father a child for a woman and her wealthy paraplegic husband.
books.title: PLAY DIRTY

books.author: Kyle Mills
books.description: When the Russian prime minister plots to invade the Baltics, only Mitch Rapp can stop him.
books.title: VINCE FLYNN: RED WAR

books.author: RaeAnne Thayne
books.description: The ninth book in the Haven Point series. Dani and the deputy sheriff become wrapped up in each other over the holidays.
books.title: SEASON OF WONDER

books.author: Lynsay Sands
books.description: The 30th book in the Argeneau series. Magnus must protect and pleasure Allie, who breaks into a blood bank to feed a baby vampire.
books.title: IMMORTAL BORN

books.author: William W Johnstone and JA Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: The third book in the Perley Gates Western series. A widow, a fortune and a man named Possom make Perley’s cattle drive more troublesome.
books.title: BULLETS DON'T ARGUE

books.title: THE ONE AND ONLY IVAN
